definition[0]: to wait for a short time
example[0]: Hold on, I’ll just get my coat.
definition[1]: used when you have just noticed, heard, or remembered something interesting or wrong
example[1]: Hold on a minute! Isn’t that your brother’s car over there?
definition[2]: used to ask someone on the telephone to wait until the person they want to talk to is available
example[2]: Can you hold on? I’ll try to find her.
definition[3]: to have your hands or arms tightly around something
definition[4]: to continue doing something that is very difficult to do
example[5]: San Francisco held on to win 4–2.
